title: South Africa projects wider budget deficits, higher debt
text:
South Africa projects wider budget deficits, higher debt

Commodities 20 minutes ago (Oct 30, 2019 14:12)

South Africa projects wider budget deficits, higher debt CAPE TOWN, Oct 30 (Reuters) - South Africa forecast wider budget deficits for the current 2019/20 fiscal year and the next two years amid weak economic growth, shortfalls in revenue and bailouts of struggling state-owned companies, the Treasury said on Wednesday. In a medium-term budget policy statement, the Treasury said the budget deficit was likely to reach 5.9% of gross domestic product (GDP) in the 2019/20 fiscal year, which began in April, from a previous estimate of 4.5%. The projected deficit would be the highest since 2009/10.
